snippet: Jean-Claude Mas, of Poly Implants Prothèses, is accused of selling hundreds of thousands of defective implants to more than 65 countries.
abstract: Jean-Claude Mas, founder of French company accused of selling hundreds of thousands of defective breast implants to more than 65 countries, appears in courthouse in Marseille, with more than 300 victims in attendance; he and four of his former employees are accused of aggravated fraud after their company Poly Implants Protheses used an inferior, industrial-grade silicone to fill implants for a decade.
lead_paragraph: Jean-Claude Mas, of Poly Implants Prothèses, is accused of selling hundreds of thousands of defective implants to more than 65 countries.

headline.seo: Company Founder Makes Court Appearance in Breast-Implant Case
headline.main: Company Founder Makes Court Appearance in Breast-Implant Case
headline.print_headline: France: Trial on Flawed Implants Opens
